Key Match Events: Nepal succumbed to a six-wicket defeat at the hands of the Netherlands in their opening group fixture of the ongoing T20 World Cup in Texas, USA.
Man-of-the-match Tim Pringle's impressive figures of 3/20 and Max O'Dowd's composed, unbeaten 54 guided the Dutch to a convincing victory over Nepal.
Sompal Kami provided Nepal with a dream start by dismissing opener Michael Levitt.
Dipendra trapped Vikramjit Singh leg before for 22 runs off 28 balls.
Kami managed to run out Sybrand Engelbrecht off his own bowling.
Avinash Bohara bowled Dutch skipper Scott Edwards.
Max O'Dowd reached his milestone of 50 runs and guided his team to victory.
Sompal Kami, Abinash Bohara and Dipendra Singh Airee took a wicket each.
Tim Pringle and Logan van Beek took three wickets each, while Paul van Meekeren and Bas de Leede shared four wickets to wrap up Nepal's innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Nepal's skipper Rohit Kumar Paudel acknowledged the Dutch bowlers for capitalizing on the early conditions and mentioned the lack of partnerships in the middle as the turning point of the game.
Dutch skipper Edwards commented on the pitch challenges and the need for consistency in their performances to progress further.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas.
Nepal's next group fixture is against Sri Lanka at the Central Broward Park in Florida on June 12th.
